contentList.content: Blessed with the favour of a goddess, Nightsong cannot be permanently killed.
Incoming damage is reduced by your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>

Allies make this <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and Undead make it with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Rupture the earth, causing debris to tear through all nearby enemies, dealing [1], and an additional [1] to knocked <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> creatures.

The hawk's keen gaze guides your aim, revealing your prey's vulnerabilities. Targets that have [1]% or fewer <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> take an additional [2] from <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag>.

When you make a lt;LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attack </LSTag>, it gains a +[1] bonus to the <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> and deals additional damage equal to half your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> (rounded down). The bonus damage can only occur once per turn.

The cloak infuses your projectile with the piercing force of a hawk's talons. Your <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">ranged weapon attacks</LSTag> against creatures within [1] of you do an additional [2] damage based off the type of ranged weapon used. This effect can only occur once per turn.

At the start of combat, the crossbow activates, causing bolts of magical energy to lash out. For 3 turns, whenever a creature damages you with an attack, the attacker takes [1]. This can only occur once per turn.

Activate the staff to gain <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> equal to half your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>, rounded up. This effect can only occur once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

When you cast a spell and spend at least 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>, you gain a bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Spell Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SpellDifficultyClass">Spell Save DC</LSTag> equal to half the spell level cast, rounded up. This bonus lasts 1 turn. This effect can only occur once per turn.

For every <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> you have unused (up to a maximum of 20 unused Sorcery Points), your spells deals an additional +1 damage. This effect can only occur once per turn.
Your spells deal an additional +1 damage for each <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag> you have unspent. This effect can only occur once per turn.
Instantly regain a number of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> equal to half your Sorcerer level, rounded up.
While <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentrating</LSTag>, you gain a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

The amulet floods your being with raw magical energy, allowing you to draw upon its infinite reserves of <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>. You can only use this effect once per turn, and once you do, you take [1]. (Metamagic ability needs to be active.)

In moments of dire need, you clench your fist. A divine spark answers within the gauntlets, allowing you to cast your next spell of up to 4th level without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ChannelDivinity">Channel Divinity</LSTag>.
Heal a target for [1] and remove <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blindness</LSTag> and any diseases.

The wearer and allies within [1] deal an additional [2] damage with <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">melee weapon attacks</LSTag>, and all damage received is reduced by [2]. This bonus is equal to the wearer's <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> minus 1.
Entity deals an additional [1] damage with <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">melee weapon attacks</LSTag> and takes [1] less damage from all sources.

Grant a protective stonelike hide to all allies in the targeted area, giving them <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage but reducing their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1].

Landing a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a weapon attack fuels your aggression, causing your next weapon attack to deal an additional [1]. This effect can only occur once per turn.

Entity has it's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> reduced by -[1].

The amulet's insatiable hunger sinks its teeth into you, forging a shield of dark power from your stolen life force. Until combat ends, you have a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> equal to half your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>, rounded up, up to a max of +4.

The amulet's hunger claws at your very being, demanding sacrifice for its power. At the start of combat, you suffer [1] but become armoued with shadowy energy. The dagger resonates with the eternal nature of your pact, granting you unique benefits that reflect your chosen pact.

Pact of the Blade - While Pact Weapon is active, your weapon deals an additional [1] and you gain Resistance to Psychic damage. This effect can only occur once per turn.

Pact of the Tome - You gain +[3] to spell Attack Rolls and Spell Save DC, and your cantrips also deal an additonal [4]. This effect can only occur once per turn.

The Oath of the Crown is sworn to the ideals of civilization, be it the spirit of a nation or fealty to a sovereign. The Knights who swear this Oath dedicate themselves to serving society, and in particular, the just laws that hold society together.
These Paladins are the watchful guardians on the walls, standing against the chaotic tides of barbarism that threaten to tear down all that civilization has built, and are commonly known as Guardians, Exemplars, or Sentinals. Often, Knights who swear this Oath are members of an order of Knighthood in service to a nation or sovereign, and undergo their Oath as part of their admission to the order's ranks.

The tenets of the Oath of the Crown are often set by the sovereign to which their oath is sworn, but generally emphasize the following tenets:

Law. The Law is paramount. It is the mortar that holds the stones of civilization together, and it must be respected.

Loyalty. Your word is your bond. Without loyalty, Oaths and Laws are meaningless.

Courage. You must be willing to do what needs to be done for the sake of order, even in the face of overwhelming odds. If you don't act, then who will?

Responsibility. You must deal with the consequences of your actions, and you are responsible for fulfilling your duties and obligations.
Failure to abide by their tenets will result in a paladin forsaking their Oath, and becoming something very different.

Distant cousins of the Elves, the Shadar Kai are devotees of the Raven Queen.
Sworn to the Raven Queen's service, the mysterious Shadar-Kai originate from Shadowfel. Once fey, they have lost their vibrance and emotion.
Once simply a pile of bones in an old tomb, you have not only been raised, you have also gone through an Awakening spell, bringing sentience back to what's left of your body.

One of the fastest growing Dunmeri martial arts, the Way of Marshmerrow is a relatively new creation, based on the teachings of Khajiit martial artists. Its teachings weave a practicioners willpower and spiritual essence with more traditional unarmed combat techniques.
Monks of this tradition are capable of utilizing their <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="KiPoint">Ki Points</LSTag> to create effects similar to traditional Illusion spells using controlled breathing techniques.
The number of times you can channel raw magic into an aura.
The number of times you can use Psionic abilities.

It is equal to your Proficiency Bonus.
Used to cast spells. These spell slots don't replenish after a long rest.

“The mouse smiled brightly: it outfoxed the cat! Then down came the claw and that, love, was that.” - Raphael reciting a lullaby
“Forged from the soul of a priestess who broke her vows and willingly gave herself into a dozen incubi.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“A treat for any demon is the soul of those who seek power to betray their own friends.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“The Putrid Flesh was forged from the soul of a necromancer who feasted on corpses.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“Not all souls willingly trade with Avernus. The Glacial Root encloses the soul of a young ice dragon, hunted down by demons for fun.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“Demons are as kin to their kind as they are to mortals. It's unclear if this axe was a reward or a punishment for a Bloodwar soldier.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'

“Raggar the Oathbreaker betrayed his brothers and brought a reign of terror to Aslanfell. He was killed by his former Moonranger companions, but Avernus still has plans for his soul.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“An old blacksmith from Kara-Tur, whose only pride was his perfect swords. He was cursed to see his lifework shattered for eternity.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“If the legend is true, a god himself forged his own soul into a sword to create a weapon to kill his rivals of their kind.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
“During the fall of the Netherese Empire, a powerful wizard made a pact with Avernus. He saved his body and lost his soul forevermore.” - Iwethia Thurin, 'Armoris Maleficarum, a study on Avernus.'
At the end of your turn, you will take [1] if you don't kill a target with your cursed weapon this turn or fullfil its <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="AWCW_Sated_Passive">Satiated</LSTag> condition.
Kill a target using your Cursed Weapon or fullfil an special unique action to soothe its Hunger of Souls for a turn.
Seduce their immortal souls, fill their minds with visions of eternal pleasure, and soothe your Cursed Weapon's hunger by <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charming</LSTag> a creature.
Soothe your Cursed Weapon's hunger by dealing damage to an ally while using this weapon.
Soothe your Cursed Weapon's hunger by feeding on the weak, dealing damage with this weapon to a target afflicted by negative conditions.
Soothe your Cursed Weapon's hunger by striking a target with cold damage.
Soothe your Cursed Weapon's hunger by striking a target with fire damage.

Soothe your Cursed Weapon's hunger by inflicting a negative condition on a creature.

Each time the wielder takes damage in combat, they gain a quarter of it as Ecstasy stacks (rounding down, minimum 1). This weapon attacks deal an additional [1] for each stack. One stack is lost at the end of each turn and all stacks are lost at the end of combat.
Lust Rapier attacks deal an additional [1] for each stack.
Stealthily attack an ally with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>, dealing an additional [1] and gaining half the damage dealt as Feed on Friends stacks.

The wielder's charisma score is reduced by 2. Living creatures within [1] of them have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.

Cannot move and takes [1] per turn. <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against the creature have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>, while the creature's <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Fire damage. This halberd slashes with burning fury dealing an additional [1], but only for its Devil master.
Conjure a Basket Full of Equipment into your inventory.

This spell conjures a Ghost Basket into your inventory that will disappear after 10 turns. Take your desired items out of the Ghost Basket before that. Everything left in the Ghost Basket will disappear forever.
You summoned a temporary Basket Full of Equipment to your inventory. It and all its contents will disappear soon.

Throw all caution to the wind to gain Advantage on your melee Attack roll, and taking a chance to cause a Wild Magic Surge. Until your next turn, you have Advantage on all Attack Rolls, but enemies also have Advantage on Attack Rolls against you.
For the next minute, you can see invisible creatures and objects.
You cast fireball centered on yourself.
Your weapon attacks do an additional [1].
You are polymorphed into cheese. You revert to your original form after 1 minute, or when reduced to 0 hit points.
Afflicted with confusion. You are hostile to everyone, wander around aimlessly, and occasionally skip your turn. A successful Wisdom Saving Throw removes this condition.
For one minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of your turn.
You are incapactiated for this turn.
You cast Grease, centered on yourself.
All creatures (except yourself) in a 30 foot radius have disadvantage on all saving throws for the next 3 turns.
You have disadvantage on all saving throws.
Cast Faerie Fire centered on yourself.
You summon a Mind Sanctuary bubble centered on yourself and can use actions and bonus actions interchangeably. This effect lasts for 3 turns.
You are compelled to always tell the truth. You have disadvantage on deception skill checks.
You are banished to another plane of existence for 2 turns.
The next spell that hits does maximum damage.
You become charged with a massive amount of static electricity. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you deal 1d6 lightning damage to them.
For one minute, any creature that hits you will be charmed for 2 turns.
For one minute, any creature that hits you with a melee attack is pushed back 10 foot.
You have advantage on all Constitution saving throws and ability checks. This condition is removed after a long rest.
For one minute, all allies (including yourself) in a 30 foot radius fall under the Blink condition.
All non-hostile creatures have the spell Friends cast on them. This spell lasts for 10 minutes.
A distracting headache is making it difficult to think clearly. Your Intelligence is reduced by 2. This condition is removed after a long rest.
You regain all of your expended Level 1 spell slots.
Your body starts to glow and emits a light that eliminates nearby darkness.
Lightning strikes! All creatures (except yourself) in a 15 foot radius take 2d10 lightning damage. Creatures that succeed a dexterity saving throw take half damage.
Every creature in a 30 foot radius becomes invisible.
For one minute, you are resistant to all physical damage.
All creature (except yourself) in a 60 foot radius must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or becomed Poisoned for 2 turns.
You glow brightly in a 30 foot radius. Any enemy that is within 10 foot will be blinded. Blinded creatures must roll a Constitution saving throw to remove this condition.
You become a sheep for 5 turns.
You summon a minor illusion that lasts for one minute
All hostile enemies in a 60 foot radius gain the Death Ward condition. On a lethal hit, they survive with 1 hitpoint remaining.
All creatures (except yourself) take 1d10 necrotic damage, or take half as much damage with a successful Constitution saving throw. You regain half of all damage dealt.
You cast Mirror Image on yourself.
All creatures in a 30 foot radius gain the ability to fly.
You cast Invisibility on yourself. Invisibility ends early if you attack, cast another spell, interact with an object, take an action or bonus action, or are damaged.
You are able to use Revivify until your next long rest.
For one minute all creatures (including yourself) gain the Enlarged condition. While Enlarged, entities have advantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws and weapons deal an extra 1d4 damage.

For one minute all creatures (including yourself) in a 30 foot radius gain the Reduced condition. While Reduced, entities have disadvantage on Strength Checks and Saving Throws and weapons deal 1d4 less damage.
All creatures (including yourself) in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to piercing damage for one minute.
You are cursed to become a clown. You gain +1 Charisma (up to a maximum 20) and have immunity to Tasha's Hideous Laughter.
You gain another action for the duration of combat.
You regain all expended Rage Charges.
You cast Haste on all creatures (except yourself) in a 30 foot radius.
You temporarily lock all doors and chests nearby in a 100 foot radius for one minute.
You unlock all nonmagical locks in a 100 foot radius.
For one minute, you enjoy the company of a menagerie of familiars.
For the next 3 turns, all of your attack rolls are critical.

You are able to read minds and gain access to the spell Detect Thoughts. Others are able to read your mind as well. You have disadvantage on all Charisma based skill checks. This condition is removed after a long rest.
At the start of your next turn, all creatures in a 30 foot radius will become vulnerable to a random damage type. This condition will last for one minute.
For one minute, all creatures in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to Acid.
For one minute, all creatures in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to Cold.
For one minute, all creatures in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to Fire.
For one minute, all creatures in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to Force.
For one minute, all creatures in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to Lightning.
For one minute, all creatures in a 30 foot radius are vulnerable to Necrotic Damage.

When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you deal 1d6 fire damage in a 10 foot radius around the target. Targets that succeed a dexterity saving throw take half damage. For a spell of first level or higher, add a additional 1d6.
The next time you are healed, you regain full health.
For every 500 gold you have in your inventory, you take 1d6 fire damage.
You summon Percy, the Pacifist Kobold. Percy will help you, but will not attack. Percy knows the spells Sanctuary, Heroism, Healing Word and Resistance.
If this creature attacks another creature, they explode in a 20 foot radius and take 8d4+36 Force Damage. Creatures that succeed a dexterity saving throw take half damage.
All creatures in a 30 foot radius that fail a Wisdom saving throw become fearful of you and drop their weapons.
You are cursed with Vampirism! You gain access to Bite, Claws, and Charm Person. Your Charisma increases by 1 (up to a maximum 20).
You transform into a cloud of mist for 3 turns.
A rainstorm starts above you; Anything underneath the storm becomes wet.
You become immune to fire for one minute. You are also on fire for one minute. You can not put out this fire.

The righteous blade of Helm, precisely where it belongs - buried through the chest of the wicked and the monstrous.
During the Time of Troubles, Helm was forced to slay the goddess Mystra as she tried to return home. Something in this sword's unrelenting line speaks to that grief - a duty completed, at any cost.

You have Advantage on Saving Throws to maintain Concentration.

You can also use a Reaction to cast a spell when a hostile creature's movement provokes an Opportunity Attack from you.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an Opportunity Attack from you, you can use your Reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an Opportunity Attack.

The spell must have a casting time of one Action and must target only that creature.

You have Advantage on Saving Throws to maintain Concentration.

You can also use a Reaction to cast a spell at a target moving out of melee range.

When a creature provokes an Opportunity Attack from you by leaving your reach, you can take a Reaction to cast a spell at the creature rather than making an Opportunity Attack.

The spell must have a casting time of one Action and must target only that creature.
